abstract: Justice Department officials said Liu Wen sold the secrets for more than $500,000 and was trying to sell them for $4 million before authorities uncovered the scheme.
snippet: Justice Department officials said Liu Wen sold the secrets for more than $500,000 and was trying to sell them for $4 million before authorities uncovered the scheme.
lead_paragraph: A jury in Baton Rouge, La., on Monday found a former Dow Chemical scientist guilty of conspiring to steal company secrets and sell them to firms in China, the Justice Department said.

headline.main: Ex-Dow Scientist Is Convicted of Selling Secrets in China
headline.print_headline: Ex-Dow Scientist Is Convicted Of Selling Secrets in China
